Mod.name: SpicyTP:Core
Mod.description:
[h1]Spicy's Texture Pack: Core 1.0.2.0[/h1] is the original resource pack for Noita. It aims to give most of the game a clean and unified aesthetic by way of many visual overhauls in one consistent style, including sleeker UI, more detailed materials, redesigned enemies, touched-up pixel scenes, and much more. [h3]Join the Discord![/h3] [url=https://discord.gg/4nN8KHBY6R]My personal Discord[/url] contains categories for things that I work on. I'd recommend joining if you're interested in seeing early previews of what's being worked on.
[hr][/hr] [h2]What sprites does this mod overhaul?[/h2] This mod currently supports: [list] [*]Vanilla - [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2859751773/3372657164725020666]800 sprites[/url] [*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2889150139]Pride Glimmers[/url] - [url=]16 sprites[/url] [/list] ...and much more to come.
[h3]Toggles[/h3] Toggles for most of the mod's features exist; they're on by default, and can be turned off to use their vanilla versions. The following is a list of what can't be toggled off, usually due to hardcoding: [list] [*]Generic, HUD, inventory, and infobox UI elements [*]The lightning ray particle [/list]
[h3]See also[/h3] To further customize your visuals, be sure to visit the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2887423419]STP collection on the Steam Workshop[/url] or the [url=https://github.com/SpicySpaceSnake/SpicyTP/wiki]STP GitHub repository's wiki[/url].
[hr][/hr] [h2]Is this mod compatible with X?[/h2] SpicyTP is a relative friendly mod and really shouldn't break anything. At most, a Mod X that overrites the same files or edits the same sections of files as SpicyTP may take priority over this mod if Mod X loads after it; likewise, this mod will take priority over others, though that's usually beneficial due to the nature of a texture pack.
[b]Found a bug? Leave a comment or start a discussion![/b]
[hr][/hr] [h2]Will there ever be cross-mod support?[/h2] [b]Yes![/b] There's already a fair bit of cross-mod content that I want to do (alongside further vanilla content updates), although I don't know what exactly I'll be doing next or when I'll do it. Also, I'm not familiar with every mod out there! If you're the owner of (or somehow affiliated with) a mod that you want me to add support for, consider reaching out to ask.
[hr][/hr] [h2]How often does this mod update?[/h2] Updates are fairly sparse, likely taking about 1-3 months if not more; biomes are hefty and large, and I'm currently undergoing several life changes that hinder my ability to make art in one way or another. In practice, this varies; after all, this is merely a hobby project, and other things may take complete priority over this mod.
[b]CURRENT PRIMARY FOCUS(ES)[/b] [list] [*]Temple of the Art [*]Holy Mountains [*]The Laboratory/The Work (End) [/list]
[b]CURRENT SECONDARY FOCUS(ES)[/b] [list] [*]Projectiles [*]Items [/list]
[b]CURRENT STATUS:[/b] in backburner development
[i]Status last verified Jan 5, 2024 Mod last updated Jan 5, 2024[/i]
